solution.text:
Since, the first 3 years will follow simple interest, SI = \( \frac{P \times R \times T}{100} \)
In this case, Principal amount(P) = Rs. _{{50000*j}}_
Rate of interest(R) = 10 %
Time period (T) = 3 years.
Simple Interest = \(\frac{_{{50000*j}}_ \times 10 \times 3}{100}\) = Rs. _{{15000*j}}_
Total amount = P + SI
\( \Rightarrow \) Therefore, total amount = _{{50000*j}}_ + _{{15000*j}}_ = Rs. _{{65000*j}}_

content.text: Imagine his surgery cost him Rs. _{{50000*j}}_ at an interest rate of 10 %, How much money would he have to repay if he returned the loan in 3 years?
